meanings.sent1: By not providing equal opportunities, you are disadvantaging some students.
meanings.sent2: She felt like she was disadvantaging her team by not being fully prepared.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon was disadvantaging the birds by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were disadvantaging the sun, hiding its brightness.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was like disadvantaging reality itself.

meanings.definition: To hinder or harm the progress or success of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His constant interruptions were disadvantaging the group's ability to finish the project.
meanings.sent2: The lack of funding was disadvantaging the development of the new technology.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was disadvantaging the gardener by digging up the newly planted seeds.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog was disadvantaging the travelers, making it hard to see the road ahead.
meanings.sent5: The virus was disadvantaging the computer system, causing it to crash repeatedly.
